BBEX3.M.PEN.USD.CA.AB.A01: Exchange rates for the US dollar in Peru / USD 1 = PEI / PEN ... (selling) *

General: * The exchange rates recorded up to the end of June 1991 were in "millones de intis". Currency conversion with effect from 1 July 1991 at the rate of PEI (intis) 1,000,000 = PEN (nuevo sol) 1; banknotes and coins denominated in PEN only entered into circulation from October 1991 onward. To prepare for the currency conversion, from 1 January 1991, all amounts denominated in inti (including in documents, on cheques, in prices and exchange rates) were indicated in millions and were accompanied by the words "millones de intis"; ie 530,000 intis = 0.53  "millones de intis".
Source: Since March 2003 Superintendencia de Banca, Seguros y AFP, Lima 1991 - end of February 2003 Dresdner Bank Lateinamerika AG, Hamburg (formerly: Deutsch-Südamerikanische Bank AG)
